results.title: Young and Innocent = a Girl Was Young
results.creator_credit: GFD, Gainsborough Pictures, Edward Black and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A mysterious man with a twitch in his eye; a young woman’s body washed ashore along with the raincoat belt used to strangle her; the supposedly innocent owner of the raincoat, fleeing from the police and frantically seeking the real murderer - all these elements combine to produce a full-speed, nail-biting mystery melodrama from the master of suspense, Alfred Hitchcock. Based on the novel A shilling for candles by Josephine Tey.
results.title_for_label: Young and Innocent = a Girl Was Young

results.title: Young airmen: new strength for the RAAF
results.brief_description: The training of 16-year-old men as radio engineers at Melbourne Technical College. This info-documentary highlights the training and education of young men to join the air force. They are trained in radio, morse code and other techniques to allow them to detect enemy planes in darkness. “Radio technology is the tool of the future for communication” (1950). Photography: Geoff Thompson.

results.title: You, your pets and neighbours
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and Record Group and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Shows the correct way of training a puppy, hygiene principles and the types and amounts of food required by various pets. Partly narrated by, and starring Sid James.

results.title: You were never lovelier
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Louis F. Edelman and William A. Seiter
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire and Rita Hayworth dance up a storm in this classic musical romance set in Buenos Aires. Maria (Hayworth) is the coolly elegant, eldest daughter of hotel magnate Edward Acuna, the most opinionated man in South America. Having inherited her father’s misanthropy, Maria has created havoc for her two sisters who can’t wed until she marries a man of Acuna’s choice. Along comes Robert Davies (Astaire), a carefree American dancer, down on his luck in Argentina. Unfortunately for Davies, Acuna can’t stand him, especially when he’s dancing around the hotel and chasing after his lovely daughter.

results.title: You see, I've had a life
results.creator_credit: Eccentric Circle Cinema Workshop and Ben Levin
results.brief_description: Paul is a 13-year-old typical all-American boy, but with a difference - he has leukaemia. Fortunately his family does not seek to hide ten reality of his illness but tries to share and face the experience with him. The film is particularly useful with teenage children as they will readily identity with the principle subject.

results.title: You promised me gold
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Nick Torrens and David Haythornthwaite
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
This is one of eight programs that look at different athletes preparing themselves for the Commonwealth Games of 1982. Alex Baumann, the athlete studied in this program, is a swimmer who is training for the Games despite a nagging shoulder injury that has prevented him from participating in other competitions.

results.title: You only live twice
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, EON, Harry Saltzman, Lewis Gilbert and Ken Adam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The head of the evil SPECTRE organisation- Ernest Blofeld (Donald Pleasence), has mastermined a plan that could lead to World War 111. He’s using a rocketship to seize manned space missions from Earth’s orbit, causing them to mysteriously disappear. The world’s superpowers, America and Russian- unbeknownst of Blofeld’s plans, suspect one another and as the suspicion mounts, the world teeters on the brink of war. Enter suave, smooth and sophisticated secret agent 007 (Sean Connery) who, accompanied by an attractive Japanese agent Kissy Suzuki (Mie Hama) and scores of Ninja warriors plan a daring attack on Blofeld’s headquarters nestled in an inactive volcano. Screenplay by Roald Dahl and title song performed by Nancy Sinatra. Cast includes Tetsuro Tamba, Akiko Wakabayashi, Karin Dor, Bernard Lee and Desmond Llewellyn.

results.title: You Must Remember This
results.creator_credit: Vivid Pictures, Susan MacKinnon and Helen Bowden
results.brief_description: Alzheimer’s disease is very common, mysterious and fatal. This film follows the course of the disease from diagnosis to death. It looks at the subtle, early signs of Alzheimer’s disease and the slow loss of language, memory and skills. It looks at what is known about its causes, current treatments and where the hopes for a cure lie.
